intro: Chilopsis linearis subsp. linearis, commonly known as the desert willow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features slender, willow-like leaves and produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or orange. It is well adapted to drought conditions and thrives in full sun. The flowers attract hummingbirds and other pollinators, making it an important species in local ecosystems.
